entry.title: Former Belgian minister takes Turkish regime to the International Court
entry.summary: Former Belgian cabinet minister Johan Vande Lanotte has joined the Turkey Tribunal charity, (an opinion tribunal), and the European association of magistrates Medel to file a case against the regime of Turkish President Erdogan at the ICC, the International Criminal Court. They are accusing the Turkish government of crimes against humanity.

link.title: Former Belgian minister takes Turkish regime to the International Court
Former Belgian minister takes Turkish regime to the International Court

entry.title: Flemings enthusiastic car-sharers
entry.summary: Car-sharing is becoming increasingly popular across Flanders. Today 120,000 people are signed up to one of a growing number of car-share operators in Belgium and the lion’s share are people in northern Belgium. Car-sharing is handy and cheap, particularly if you don’t need a car that often.

link.title: Flemings enthusiastic car-sharers
Flemings enthusiastic car-sharers

entry.title: Driest February in 37 years
entry.summary: February 2023 will go down on record as having been the driest February since 1986. During the whole of this month just 13.3mm of rain fell at the Royal Meteorological Institute’s (KMI) weather centre in the Brussels municipality of Ukkel. The amount of precipitation for the winter as a whole has been more or less normal. Nevertheless, nature could certainly use a bit of additional rain to help prepare it for the potentially dry summer months that are coming up.

link.title: Driest February in 37 years
Driest February in 37 years

entry.title: VIDEO: Avian flu decimates black-headed gulls in Limburg
entry.summary: For two weeks now dead black-headed gulls have been washing ashore along the River Maas in Limburg Province. All have died as a result of avian or bird flu. Other birds are becoming unwell, but it’s above all black-headed gulls that are dying.

link.title: VIDEO: Avian flu decimates black-headed gulls in Limburg
VIDEO: Avian flu decimates black-headed gulls in Limburg

entry.title: Body of missing woman (75) found in woodland at Maasmechelen
entry.summary: The body of a 75-year-old woman that had been missing since last week has been found in woodland at Maasmechelen in Limburg Province. Emilia Chini, who was living with dementia, was last seen last Wednesday close to her home in the Eisden-Tuinwijk area of Maasmechelen. The pensioner’s body was found in the Mechels Bos Woods.

link.title: Body of missing woman (75) found in woodland at Maasmechelen
Body of missing woman (75) found in woodland at Maasmechelen

entry.title: Sharp increase in the number of car-sharers in Belgium
entry.summary: 2022 saw the number of car-sharers in Belgium increase by 40%. By the end of last year 121,394 people in Belgium were sharing a car, either with friends or neighbours or as a subscriber to a car-sharing service such as Cambio or Miles. Never before were there so many Belgians sharing cars.

link.title: Sharp increase in the number of car-sharers in Belgium
Sharp increase in the number of car-sharers in Belgium

entry.title: Shopkeeper that stabbed to death an intruder to remain in custody
entry.summary: A shopkeeper from the Limburg municipality of Houthalen-Helchteren will remain in custody for the time being. During the weekend the shopkeeper was involved in an incident with an intruder. The intruder was stabbed and died of his injuries.

link.title: Shopkeeper that stabbed to death an intruder to remain in custody
Shopkeeper that stabbed to death an intruder to remain in custody

entry.title: Range of products that can be purched using Ecocheques to be expanded from Wednesday
entry.summary: As ever a new month brings with it a range of new rules, regulations and other measures that affect us in our daily lives. One such measure that comes into force from tomorrow (1March) is an expansion of the range of products that can be purchased using the Ecocheques that some of us receive from our employers.

link.title: Range of products that can be purched using Ecocheques to be expanded from Wednesday
Range of products that can be purched using Ecocheques to be expanded from Wednesday

entry.title: Disruption as postal workers stage a 24-hour strike
entry.summary: Employees of the Belgian Post office Bpost are taking industrial action in protest at the company’s reorganization plans. Luc Tegethoff of the liberal public service union VSOA told VRT Radio 1 that while newspapers will be delivered today it could well be a very different story with regard to letters and parcels.

link.title: Disruption as postal workers stage a 24-hour strike
Disruption as postal workers stage a 24-hour strike

entry.title: Average rent in Flanders now at 815 euro/month
entry.summary: The price of renting a property in Flanders has increased significantly. Figures published in the real estate federation CIB’s annual “Rent Barometer” show a year-on-year increase of 4.7% in the average price paid to rent a property in our region. A shortage of properties to rent and demand for energy efficient properties are serving to fuel the increase in rents.

link.title: Average rent in Flanders now at 815 euro/month
Average rent in Flanders now at 815 euro/month

entry.title: Bar to pass Flemish integration test goes higher
entry.summary: The result newcomers need to obtain in order to pass the Flemish integration test is becoming more demanding starting 1 March. Newcomers taking the test will have to be able to answer 9 out of 11 questions about "basic fundamental values" correctly.

link.title: Bar to pass Flemish integration test goes higher
Bar to pass Flemish integration test goes higher

entry.title: Northern lights in Belgium for first time in a decade (VIDEO)
entry.summary: For the first time in a decade the northern lights (aurora borealis) were visible in Belgium last night. Unfortunately, the lights couldn’t yet be seen by the naked eye, but they could be photographed with the right settings. If conditions are favourable, the northern lights could become visible for all tonight.

link.title: Northern lights in Belgium for first time in a decade (VIDEO)
Northern lights in Belgium for first time in a decade (VIDEO)

entry.title: Inflation nearly halves in only 4 months
entry.summary: Belgian year-on-year inflation – the rate at which prices in the shops rise - has taken a new knock. February inflation stood at 6.62%,down from 8.05% in January. The fall is attributed to lower energy prices. Meanwhile food inflation continues to rise.

link.title: Inflation nearly halves in only 4 months
Inflation nearly halves in only 4 months

entry.title: Record ‘Reading Aloud in Multiple Languages’ set in Schaarbeek
entry.summary: Children and adults from local schools set a new record for reading aloud in the highest number of languages at the Bib Sophia Library in Schaarbeek (Brussels) last Sunday. Excerpts of Leo Timmers’s ‘Magical Life of Mr Renny ‘were read out in 65 different languages.

link.title: Record ‘Reading Aloud in Multiple Languages’ set in Schaarbeek
Record ‘Reading Aloud in Multiple Languages’ set in Schaarbeek

entry.title: Rail strike on 10 March
entry.summary: Staff at Belgium’s publicly owned rail company NMBS are taking industrial action on 10 March. The unions say workers are worried about rail underfunding and staffing levels: “We can no longer offer our passengers a good service”.

link.title: Rail strike on 10 March
Rail strike on 10 March

entry.title: Record cocaine seizure as Belgian home minister visits Ecuador
entry.summary: Belgian home minister Annelies Verlinden (Flemish Christian democrat) is accompanying European commissioner for home affairs Ylva Johansson to Ecuador and Colombia on a trip intended to step up cooperation between Belgium, the EU and the two Latin American countries in the fight against drugs trafficking. During the first day of the Belgian’s visit a massive cache of cocaine bound for Belgium was intercepted.

link.title: Record cocaine seizure as Belgian home minister visits Ecuador
Record cocaine seizure as Belgian home minister visits Ecuador

entry.title: Peter Goossens to leave 3-star Hof van Cleve
entry.summary: Hof Van Cleve, Peter Goossens’s restaurant in Kruisem (East Flanders) that has been awarded three Michelin stars, will soon be under new leadership. The celebrated Flemish chef is selling up.

link.title: Peter Goossens to leave 3-star Hof van Cleve
Peter Goossens to leave 3-star Hof van Cleve

entry.title: VIDEO: Vigils for Belgian aid worker held in Iranian jail
entry.summary: Vigils were held for Olivier Vandecasteele, the Belgian aid worker incarcerated in Iran, across Belgium yesterday. In Brussels, Ghent, Leuven, Namur and Tournai people gathered to demand his immediate release. Olivier’s sister Nathalie Vandecasteele told VRT: “We want to continue to pile on the pressure on politicians. He needs to be freed ASAP because he has health issues and is still in solitary confinement.

link.title: VIDEO: Vigils for Belgian aid worker held in Iranian jail
VIDEO: Vigils for Belgian aid worker held in Iranian jail

entry.title: Stuffed “Roger” the centrepiece at “Pop-Up Wolves Expo”
entry.summary: A new exhibition at the Webbekoms Broek visitors’ centre in Diest (Flemish Brabant) chronicles the return of the wolf to our region after an absence of more than 100 years. The centrepiece of the exhibition is the stuffed body of a wolf that was run over and killed by a car in Limburg Province.

link.title: Stuffed “Roger” the centrepiece at “Pop-Up Wolves Expo”
Stuffed “Roger” the centrepiece at “Pop-Up Wolves Expo”

entry.title: Line manager’s leadership style plays an import role in preventing burnouts
entry.summary: According to a survey carried out by the HR-services company Securex and Leuven University (KUL) just a third of line managers have a leadership style that is conducive to helping prevent burnouts among those in their team. Among those that receive support from their line manager just 1% suffer a burnout. This figure rises to 38% among those that work under a line manager with a controlling and toxic management style.

link.title: Line manager’s leadership style plays an import role in preventing burnouts
Line manager’s leadership style plays an import role in preventing burnouts

entry.title: Pressure to convert an issue among Brussels public transport staff
entry.summary: More than three-quarters of those that work for the Brussels public transport company MIVB want greater protection against religious, political or ideologic influence exerted on them by colleagues. That’s according to a survey published earlier this week by CAL, a Francophone umbrella group comprising 28 secular, humanist organisations.

link.title: Pressure to convert an issue among Brussels public transport staff
Pressure to convert an issue among Brussels public transport staff

entry.title: Why do people have affairs?
entry.summary: Earlier this month we celebrated Valentine’s Day. Over the years it has become a celebration of loved ones in a marriage, partnership or permanent relationship, but in the United States, on the eve of Valentine’s Day, National Mistress Day is also celebrated. This is more a celebration of “unofficial relationships”.

link.title: Why do people have affairs?
Why do people have affairs?

entry.title: Search continues for 75-year-old woman missing since Wednesday
entry.summary: The search for a 75-year-old woman from the Limburg municipality of Maasmechelen entered its third day on Friday. Several teams of police officers with tracker dogs searched the Mechels Bos woods. On Thursday evening drones were deployed in an effort to find the missing pensioner. Emilia Chini went missing on Wednesday evening near to her home on the Lindelaan in the Eisden-Tuinwijk area of Maasmechelen.

link.title: Search continues for 75-year-old woman missing since Wednesday
Search continues for 75-year-old woman missing since Wednesday

entry.title: European Commission bans TikTok use
entry.summary: The European Commission has banished the use of the Chinese social media app TikTok from all its computers, tablets and staff smartphones. The measure is designed to protect the commission’s staff.

link.title: European Commission bans TikTok use
European Commission bans TikTok use

entry.title: Bonds issue raises almost 28 million euro in its first day
entry.summary: The Federal Debt Agency reports that the latest government bond issue that was launched on Thursday raised 26.8 million euro in its first day. Until next Friday those that wish to will be able to invest in the bonds that run for either 3 or 10 years.

link.title: Bonds issue raises almost 28 million euro in its first day
Bonds issue raises almost 28 million euro in its first day

entry.title: More than 1,000 patients have already been treated at Belgian B-FAST field hospital in Turkey
entry.summary: The Federal Foreign Affairs Department reports that in just one week the Belgian B-FAST field hospital in the Turkish town of Kirikhan has treated more than 1,000 people. Last week the Belgian emergency assistance intervention team B-FAST set up a field hospital with medical staff in Kirikhan, a town that suffered severe damage from the earthquakes that caused widespread death, injury and destruction earlier this month.

link.title: More than 1,000 patients have already been treated at Belgian B-FAST field hospital in Turkey
More than 1,000 patients have already been treated at Belgian B-FAST field hospital in Turkey

entry.title: Belgium scraps mandatory COVID tests for people arriving here from China
entry.summary: From Monday people arriving in Belgium from China will no longer have to undergo a mandatory test for coronavirus in order to be allowed into the country. Speaking on Friday morning, the Federal Health Minister Frank Vandenbroucke (Flemish socialist) said that from 27 February the tests will be voluntary. Testing will be scrapped completely from mid-March.

link.title: Belgium scraps mandatory COVID tests for people arriving here from China
Belgium scraps mandatory COVID tests for people arriving here from China

entry.title: 80 residency & work permits granted to Moroccan nations suspended due to suspected fraud
entry.summary: Earlier this week the Belgian Consulate in Turkey opened an investigation into suspected fraud regarding the acquisition of permits allowing Turks to come and live and work in Belgium. Now the Belgian Consulate in Morocco has followed suit. A total of 80 cases of suspected work permit fraud involving Moroccans are being investigated. The permits that had been issued to Moroccans to come and work in Flanders have now been suspended.

link.title: 80 residency & work permits granted to Moroccan nations suspended due to suspected fraud
80 residency & work permits granted to Moroccan nations suspended due to suspected fraud

entry.title: Flemish Government launches new initiative to collect emergency aid for Ukraine
entry.summary: The Flemish Government has launched a new initiative to collect aid to assist the victims of the war in Ukraine. Companies and local authorities can collect and donate goods through the scheme that is being organised in collaboration with the Flemish Red Cross, the Association of Flemish City and Municipal Authorities (VVSG) and business federations from 8 branches of industry. It’s a year to the day since the war started and the need for basic everyday goods among the people of Ukraine remains great.

link.title: Flemish Government launches new initiative to collect emergency aid for Ukraine
Flemish Government launches new initiative to collect emergency aid for Ukraine

entry.title: VIDEO: 90% drop in UK-bound migrants taking their chances on the Flemish coast
entry.summary: Greater security at Flemish ports, a new taskforce to clamp down on people-trafficking and the use of intel gleaned from mobile phones belonging to victims and suspects have all led to a sharp fall in the number of UK-bound migrants ending up on the Flemish coast. The pull of northern France, where chances of success are greater, is stronger. In comparison with 2018 there has been a 90% drop in UK-bound migrants taking their chances on the Flemish coast.

link.title: VIDEO: 90% drop in UK-bound migrants taking their chances on the Flemish coast
VIDEO: 90% drop in UK-bound migrants taking their chances on the Flemish coast

entry.title: VIDEO: One in three road deaths are cyclists or pedestrians
entry.summary: More and more people are getting on their bikes. It’s healthy and cheap but fatalities are up. Last year over 500 people died in traffic. A third were cyclists or pedestrians. Many were seniors.

link.title: VIDEO: One in three road deaths are cyclists or pedestrians
VIDEO: One in three road deaths are cyclists or pedestrians

entry.title: "National debt just shy of 120% of GDP in 2028"
entry.summary: Belgium’s national debt is set to rise to nearly 120% of national output by 2028. Figures from the government planning office suggest that if no action is taken budget deficits this year and next will total 5.7% and 5.4% of GDP or national output.

link.title: "National debt just shy of 120% of GDP in 2028"
"National debt just shy of 120% of GDP in 2028"

entry.title: VIDEO: Fire bomb attack at Antwerp pizzeria
entry.summary: A pizzeria in the Kiel district of Antwerp is the latest property to be attacked in the northern port city in what in all likelihood is a further escalation of the drugs war in the city.

link.title: VIDEO: Fire bomb attack at Antwerp pizzeria
VIDEO: Fire bomb attack at Antwerp pizzeria

entry.title: Brussels metro can’t understand why train wheels are going oval
entry.summary: Folk at the Brussels local transport company MIVB are scratching their heads. The wheels on the new M7 metro trains are wearing down faster than usual. They are being blamed for extra noise and vibrations. The transport company is puzzled because the wheels are made by the same producer and in the same way!

link.title: Brussels metro can’t understand why train wheels are going oval
Brussels metro can’t understand why train wheels are going oval

entry.title: Ex far right lawmaker to face Holocaust denial charges
entry.summary: A panel of judges has ordered that Dries Van Langenhove stand trial on charges of Holocaust denial. The former far right lawmaker already has to stand trial for inciting hate and violence as well as weapons offences.

link.title: Ex far right lawmaker to face Holocaust denial charges
Ex far right lawmaker to face Holocaust denial charges

entry.title: Man in court on charges of penetrating a horse on a Leuven square
entry.summary: A man from Leuven faced his day in court yesterday after he was accused on penetrating a horse with his hand on the Laduezeplein in the Flemish Brabantine capital. The incident allegedly happened during the filming of a TV series.

link.title: Man in court on charges of penetrating a horse on a Leuven square
Man in court on charges of penetrating a horse on a Leuven square

entry.title: Belgian long-term interest highest in a decade: what does it mean for you?
entry.summary: Belgian long-term interest rates have hit the highest level in a decade. Interest on ten-year bonds has now reached 3.2%. The further rise is bad news for mortgage holders and the Belgian state, but better news for savers.

link.title: Belgian long-term interest highest in a decade: what does it mean for you?
Belgian long-term interest highest in a decade: what does it mean for you?

entry.title: UK-bound migrants ignoring Belgium
entry.summary: The number of migrants travelling through Belgium on their way to the UK fell by 90% since 2018. Human traffickers are increasingly abandoning Belgium as a transit country in their attempts to smuggle migrants to the UK federal justice minister Vincent Van Quickenborne (Flemish liberal) said Wednesday.

link.title: UK-bound migrants ignoring Belgium
UK-bound migrants ignoring Belgium

entry.title: Flemish Brabantians get back on their bike
entry.summary: More and more Brabantians are getting on their bikes. Last year 3 million cyclists drove past a bicycle counter in Flemish Brabant Province. Leuven-Brussels remains the most popular cycle superhighway.

link.title: Flemish Brabantians get back on their bike
Flemish Brabantians get back on their bike

entry.title: Brussels cinema evacuated after cinemagoers become unwell
entry.summary: Cinéma Aventure in Brussels had to be evacuated last night after a dozen cinemagoers became unwell suffering breathing difficulty and irritation of the eyes. The fire service believes chemical substances used in neighbouring nail bars may have caused the incident. One woman even had to be hospitalised.

link.title: Brussels cinema evacuated after cinemagoers become unwell
Brussels cinema evacuated after cinemagoers become unwell

entry.title: Refugees and asylum seekers fill construction job shortage
entry.summary: A report from the Social Economic Council for Flanders identifies a great shortage of plasters and roofers. Few are the Flemish youngsters eager to embark on training for these professions, while the number of training courses isn’t sufficient either. Employers are often obliged to look further afield to find qualified workers.

link.title: Refugees and asylum seekers fill construction job shortage
Refugees and asylum seekers fill construction job shortage

entry.title: Dutch judge refuses to send asylum seeker back to Belgium due to risk of “inhumane treatment”
entry.summary: A Dutch judge has refused to send a Chinese asylum seeker back to Belgium out of concerns he could face inhumane treatment at the hands of the Belgian authorities. The Chinese national applied for asylum in the Netherlands last summer, but it soon emerged he had already applied in Belgium. As a result his application couldn’t be processed by the Dutch authorities. Under European rules he was supposed to be sent back to Belgium. The Chinese appealed against that decision pointing to the lack of capacity for asylum seekers south of the border.

link.title: Dutch judge refuses to send asylum seeker back to Belgium due to risk of “inhumane treatment”
Dutch judge refuses to send asylum seeker back to Belgium due to risk of “inhumane treatment”

entry.title: Russian spy ship had Belgian wind farms in its sights
entry.summary: Belgian justice minister Vincent Van Quickenborne (Flemish liberal), who also doubles as Minister for the North Sea, has provided details about a Russian spy ship that cruised off the Belgian coast last November. The vessel was sailing in the vicinity of Belgian windfarms and refused to identify itself. “The passage of this ship must be seen within the wider context of the war in Ukraine” Mr Van Quickenborne told VRT.

link.title: Russian spy ship had Belgian wind farms in its sights
Russian spy ship had Belgian wind farms in its sights

entry.title: “Dikkebus” becomes “Enormebus” pace Roald Dahl
entry.summary: The controversy over the updating of the words of British author Roald Dahl has crossed the English Channel and is also causing a stir in Flanders.

link.title: “Dikkebus” becomes “Enormebus” pace Roald Dahl
“Dikkebus” becomes “Enormebus” pace Roald Dahl

entry.title: Magnificent floats win prizes at Aalst Carnival
entry.summary: Three carnival groups received prizes for creating the most beautiful floats at Aalst Carnival. The prize ceremony is one of the highlights of three days of revelry in the city.

link.title: Magnificent floats win prizes at Aalst Carnival
Magnificent floats win prizes at Aalst Carnival

entry.title: Asylum seeker tent camp doesn’t get cleared as planned
entry.summary: Plans to clear a tent camp outside the Klein Kasteeltje reception centre for asylum seekers in Brussels failed to go ahead yesterday evening. Following the sealing of the Paleizenstraat squat in Schaarbeek where many asylum seekers had taken up residence numbers at the tent camp outside Klein Kasteeltje operated by Fedasil, the government agency that provides accommodation to registered asylum seekers, swelled.

link.title: Asylum seeker tent camp doesn’t get cleared as planned
Asylum seeker tent camp doesn’t get cleared as planned

entry.title: Investigation underway after explosion outside Ghent beauty salon
entry.summary: The Judicial Authorities have launched an investigation after a homemade bomb exploded outside a beauty salon in the East Flemish city of Ghent. No one was injured in the explosion that took place early on Tuesday morning. Earlier this month a similar incident took place in the Rabot area of Ghent. No significant damage was caused by the explosion.

link.title: Investigation underway after explosion outside Ghent beauty salon
Investigation underway after explosion outside Ghent beauty salon

entry.title: Tax surcharge wipes out power firm’s excessive profits
entry.summary: Higher gas and electricity prices generated higher pretax profits for power company Engie last year. Pretax profits were up 2 billion to 5 billion in 2022. In 2021 the company only made profits of 3 billion euros. However, the Belgian government introduced a tax surcharge on excessive profits by energy companies reducing Engie’s net profits to 200 million euros. Engie made excessive profits because it generates most of its energy from nuclear at no extra cost but was able to benefit from higher market prices triggered by Russia’s further invasion of Ukraine.

link.title: Tax surcharge wipes out power firm’s excessive profits
Tax surcharge wipes out power firm’s excessive profits

entry.title: Half of all De Lijn fines are never paid
entry.summary: Half the fare dodging fines issued by the Flemish transport company De Lijn are never paid. This means the company is losing out on 3.5 million euros every year. In the big cities around half of all passengers don’t possess a valid ticket. The number of fines doubled in the past 4 years but getting hold of the cash when somebody fails to pay is a terribly long procedure involving a bailiff and payment plan.

link.title: Half of all De Lijn fines are never paid
Half of all De Lijn fines are never paid

entry.title: Rubens’s Portrait of a Man as the God Mars in Brussels ahead of New York auction
entry.summary: It is not something that happens every day but in May a real Peter Paul Rubens is being auctioned at Sotheby’s in New York. The Portrait of a Man as the God Mars is currently in Belgium for the first time in 200 years and is attracting considerable interest says George Gordon (Sotheby’s Master Paintings) (VIDEO).

link.title: Rubens’s Portrait of a Man as the God Mars in Brussels ahead of New York auction
Rubens’s Portrait of a Man as the God Mars in Brussels ahead of New York auction
